title: Amores Perros
description: A fatalistic car crash in Mexico city sets off a chain of events in the lives of three people: a supermodel, a young man wanting to run off with his sister-in-law, and a homeless man. Their lives are catapulted into unforeseen situations instigated by the seemingly inconsequential destiny of a dog.

reviews.text: Touching story. Brilliant idea of the three stories. The accident episode is the key of the movie. It keeps you alert till the end. The third story was the most beautiful to me.

Certainly, a very good movie! Although one of the stories (the one of the model and the dog) was not very credible and seemed a bit forced; as a whole, the movie works well. The first time I watched this film  the impression I got from it was not very positive; however, I am happy I watched it again, because I understood if from a totally different perspective, while the first time I did, I was perhaps overly critical. I do recommend the movie! It is intense, endearing, powerful, and at times, brutal...but watching is was  a rewarding experience, just the same!...Amores Perros  definitely had a huge potential to be even more than what it was...

Amores Perros es perfecta, una obra de culto increíble y visualmente espectacular y con una historia y unos personajes muy bien desarrollados, la obra maestra que le dio el reconocimiento mundial a Alejandro Gonzalez Iñarritu es perfecta, única y original. Es como Pulp Fiction, pero en México.

Amores perros debut Alejandro Iñárritu in the big movie. Immediately turned out a masterpiece. The simplest story, a perfectly twisted plot of several character lines. Characters go through the path of development through difficult life situations. Probably the most realistic movie about Mexico. And most importantly, a very correct ending. A heavy film for perception, after it there is only a lump in the throat. A cult movie that not many will like.
Gruesome truth said if full and loud. It's well evident that Alejandro González Iñárritu has replaced the king of surrealism Luis Bunuel out from the helm.

A great movie that catches your attention for all the two-and-a-half hours that it's long. It captures the three sad stories in such a beautiful, melancholic, aesthetic way For me, all the blood and violence is part of that aestheticness. The movie seems to breathe the town, the atmosphere is conveyed great with, the people, upper class and lower. One of the best movies I've ever seen.

Although I still feel this movie is great, it's a movie best appreciated when you're watching it for the very first time. On repeated viewings, although it is still great, it just isn't as rewarding. Still, great performances from the cast and brutally realistic.
THE best movie I have seen this year, truly my vote for best foreing film. A work of art that is truly magnificent.
Writer speaks from essential to embrace absurd. Never saw movie that perfect.

Easily the best film of 2001, and, as some critics have indicated, one of the finest films of all time. The performances, writing, direction, and choice of music are all flawless. It was sad to see this same filmmaker try to create a similar masterpiece with 21 Grams, and mostly fail. If you didn't like that film, still give this one a chance. It truly is amazing.

This film is a serious take on the hyperlink genre, focusing more on social disparity than the titular love: although the three episodes take place in the same city, we see three essentially unrelated stories that could well have been set in three different countries. There are snippets of great cinema, with influences clearly ranging from 50s-60s neorealism to 90's heist films - technically, the film is a great one: camera work, cinematography, writing, editing and soundtrack are all spot on. The only downfall, I found, was the fact that although yes, it is hyperlink, and yes, the episodes are somewhat connected, Amores perros still feels very distinctly trifold. Apart from this, the movie is good and is certainly one of the best in its genre. Also, comparisons to Pulp Fiction don't really make sense, since Pulp Fiction was written with a humorous intent, while Amores perros is extremely serious and doesn't ever provide comedy at all.

Una de las películas que pusieron un antes y después en el cine mexicano. La película que puso en el radar a González Iñarritu, Gael García Bernal y Rodrigo Prieto. Una historia absorbente de causa y efecto de cómo un accidente unió de manera cortante la vida de tres perfectos desconocidos, a través de la tragedia y el perdón.

Three connected stories show the 3 different social classes in Mexico, the film feels very real and very impressive, this is undoubtedly the best movie that my country (Mexico) has given to the world.
An amazing first feature film for the brilliant director. meanings and symbols and stories altogether put in a well-reasoned pace with some incredibly awesome actings as well
Una grandiosa película sobre historias cruzadas, es cruda, tensa y emocional.¡¡¡TOTALMENTE RECOMENDADA!!!

This film remains, to date, the best film among those directed by Inarritu. He creates a nice parallelism in the four stories told: love between couples and love between dogs and their owners. The film is masterfully directed and has a beautiful cinematography. .

It is Pulp Fiction but it beams México in every way, but it's a real version of our country that we won't accept ever, the animal abuse. The best movie of Alejandro González Iñárritu, this kind of editing gets a lot of intrigue and tension. The first story was so uncomfortable and tense, the second one was interesting, but nothing more and the last one was the heart of the movie. Everybody did their best in everyway.
